app.title: Explore your Spotify streaming history
app.subtitle: Everything stays in your browser, no data is sent to a server.

fileUpload.hint: Select a ZIP archive ( my_spotify_data.zip ) or JSON file(s) ( Streaming_History_Audio_YYYY.json ).
fileUpload.tutorialTitle: How to Get Your Spotify Data
fileUpload.tutorialStep3: Wait for Spotify to email you (can take up to 30 days, but it's usually much faster)
fileUpload.tutorialStep4: Download the ZIP file from the email
fileUpload.errorNoData: No valid data found. Uploaded files must be JSON files starting with "Streaming_History_Audio_" or ZIP archives containing them. Ignored {{count}} file(s)/entry(s).
fileUpload.errorProcessing: Error processing files. Please try again.

questions.question: What data does my Extended Streaming History contain?
questions.answer: Your Extended Streaming History contains detailed information about every single track you've played. For each of the tens of thousands of data points, it records the date and time, the song name, artist, and album. It also includes exactly how long you listened (in milliseconds!), which device you used, your location (country), and even specific details like whether you shuffled, skipped the song, or if you were listening offline. It also tracks why the song started (like clicking a row) or ended (like hitting next).

subtitle.clickrow: These are the tracks you started manually most often
subtitle.backbtn: These are the tracks you started over again

reasonStartTracks.noData: No tracks found matching the criteria

dateRangeFilter.title: Date Range Filter
dateRangeFilter.subtitle: Drag the handles to filter by month and year

footer.privacy: No data is saved to your device or sent to a server.
